title: [Neuroscience] Exposure to formaldehyde at work linked to cognitive problems later. After adjusting for age, sex, other factors, researchers found people who were exposed to formaldehyde on the job had, on average, a 17% higher risk of having thinking and memory problems compared to those who were not exposed

[Health] For some people, muscle loss during old age can be so severe that it affects their ability to perform daily tasks. A new meta-analysis suggests that resistance training can markedly improve this condition, called sarcopenia, in older people by improving fat mass, muscle strength and performance.
